summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) prosecutors discussing the initiation of an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate reaching out to the FBI's sex crimes squad, obtaining the old FBI investigative file, and considering immediate subpoenas.

events.title: SDNY Prosecutors Discuss Opening Epstein Investigation
events.description: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York exchange emails about opening a new investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, coordinating with the FBI's sex crimes squad, and obtaining prior investigative files.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: On November 29, 2018, SDNY prosecutors decided to open a new investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The plan involved bringing in the FBI-NY's sex crimes squad to assist.
Prosecutors discussed obtaining the FBI investigative file from the old Epstein case.
They considered whether to issue an immediate subpoena to 'stake claim' in the investigation.
The discussion was prompted by a Miami Herald article (linked in the email) about Epstein.
